org.ensor.robots.motors.differentialdrive

Class SimpleModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ensor.robots.motors.differentialdrive.SimpleModel

  • public class SimpleModel
extends Object
    This class implements an elementary model for differential steering based on this paper. All units of length are presumed to be in terms of meters and angle measures are in terms of radians.
    Author:
    jona

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SimpleModel.SpeedAndTurnRate
      This class represents the speed of a differential drive assembly and the rate of turn.
      static class  SimpleModel.WheelVelocities
      This class represents the state of movement of a differential drive assembly by representing the velocities of each of the two wheels.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimpleModel(double aWheelDistance)
      This instantiates the simple differential drive model with the distance between the two wheels given in meters.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SimpleModel.SpeedAndTurnRate calculateBearing(SimpleModel.WheelVelocities aWheelVelocities)
      This method calculates the speed and turn rate from the given wheel velocities.
      SimpleModel.WheelVelocities calculateWheelVelocities(double aVelocity, double aRadiansPerSecond)
      This method calculates the speed of each of the wheels given the total velocity and rate of turn desired.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleModel

        public SimpleModel(double aWheelDistance)
        This instantiates the simple differential drive model with the distance between the two wheels given in meters.
        Parameters:
        aWheelDistance - The distance between the center-point of the wheels. The model assumes that the wheels rotate along the same axis independently of each other.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateBearing

        public SimpleModel.SpeedAndTurnRate calculateBearing(SimpleModel.WheelVelocities aWheelVelocities)
        This method calculates the speed and turn rate from the given wheel velocities.
        Parameters:
        aWheelVelocities - The velocities of the two wheels of the differential drive.
        Returns:
        The speed and rate of turn for the assembly.

      • calculateWheelVelocities

        public SimpleModel.WheelVelocities calculateWheelVelocities(double aVelocity,
                                                   double aRadiansPerSecond)
        This method calculates the speed of each of the wheels given the total velocity and rate of turn desired.
        Parameters:
        aVelocity - The desired total velocity.
        aRadiansPerSecond - The desired rate of turn.
        Returns:
        The left and right wheel velocities to achieve this state.
